title: East Lothian and Midlothian snow warning as Met Office warns of 'travel disruption' - Edinburgh Live
text: A new yellow [weather](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/weather) warning has been issued to parts of the Lothians as the Met Office warns of travel disruption. According to the Met Office, rain and snow could cause travel disruption across Scotland, including parts of Midlothian and [ East Lothian.](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/east-lothian) This comes just a day after the country was battered by Storm Gerrit which brought heavy rain and strong winds to Edinburgh. A clean-up operation is underway after train lines were closed, Cuper in Fife was hit by flooding, and 1,000s of homes were left without power. READ NEXT- [Moment mindless Edinburgh yobs tip van on its side after Hibs and Hearts derby](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/moment-mindless-edinburgh-yobs-tip-28362563) READ NEXT- [Edinburgh police swoop on busy street as officers spotted outside shops and homes](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/edinburgh-police-swoop-busy-street-28363568) In the latest update, the weather warning will come into force from 8am on Saturday and last until 3pm. Join [Edinburgh Live's Whatsapp Community here](https://chat.whatsapp.com/DBFongo3zQS6P8RfPA1ryO) and get the latest news sent straight to your messages. With temperatures dropping to -1C in the early hours of the morning, the weather forecasters warn that snow and wintry showers could hit parts of Midlothian and East Lothian. The weather forecasters add: "After a cold start widespread rain and hill snow will spread northeast, some sleet or snow down to low levels at first. Turning drier in the afternoon. Cold. Maximum temperature 4C." They also add that a period of sleet and snow, turning to rain on Saturday may lead to some flooding and travel disruption. Andy Page is a Met Office Chief Forecaster. He said: “Parts of the higher ground of Scotland may see temporary snow accumulations of 5-10cm, while up to 25mm of rain is expected in Wales, Northern Ireland and lower levels in Scotland. Across Wales and southern England wind gusts of 45-50mph are likely to be quite widespread, while gusts of 65-75mph are possible in the most exposed coastal areas.” Sign up for Edinburgh Live's newsletter Get all the latest news and headlines from Edinburgh, Fife and the Lothians sent straight to your inbox twice a day by signing up to our free newsletter.
